title: Monster Hunter 2 Wiki | Armor Skills
subtitle: Find here all available armor skills in the game with descriptions, to the best of my knowledge. The required points are indicated on the far left, the associated skill name for those points to the right. Any values in parentheses indicate details per skill level. English names based the English language patch by Break Arts, and best guesses from MHF2 wiki weapons pages.
head: <link type='text/css' rel='stylesheet' href='../css/armor_skills.css'/><script type='text/javascript' src='../js/armor_skills.js'></script>

armorSkills.name: Alchemy
armorSkills.desc: Allow special item combinations without the Alchemy Book.

armorSkills.name: Ammo Mixer
armorSkills.desc: Always make the maximum possible amount of ammunition when combining.

armorSkills.name: Anti-Theft
armorSkills.desc: Prevent anyone from stealing your items. Works against Melynxes, Gypceroses, and Purple Gypceroses.

armorSkills.name: Antiseptic
armorSkills.desc: Affects your susceptibility to Stench status.

armorSkills.name: Attack
armorSkills.desc: Increase your weapon's Attack. Adds the amount in parentheses to the weapon's True Damage Value before its Bloat Value.

armorSkills.name: Auto-Guard
armorSkills.desc: Block attacks automatically if your weapon is drawn. You must also be facing the direction of the incoming attack (within 180 degrees in front of you), and be free to block it (that is, not be in the middle of dodging or attacking.)

armorSkills.name: Backpacking
armorSkills.desc: Move faster while carrying an egg or other delivery item, and drop from a greater height without breaking or dropping it.

armorSkills.name: BBQ
armorSkills.desc: Make it harder, or easier, to cook meat on a BBQ Spit.

armorSkills.name: Bomber
armorSkills.desc: Increase the yield of barrel bombs, dealing 1.5x damage. See the Explosive Damage section under About Weapons in the Weapons page.

armorSkills.name: Carving
armorSkills.desc: Speeds up carving monsters.

armorSkills.name: Clust S Add
armorSkills.desc: Load Cluster Shot of increasing levels in bowguns that cannot normally use it. Each level includes the shot(s) from previous levels (see the Weapons page for which weapons have what ammo by default.)

armorSkills.name: Cold Resistance
armorSkills.desc: Hasten, reduce, or totally negate the maximum Stamina-reducing effects of cold zones.

armorSkills.name: Combo Success
armorSkills.desc: Increase, or reduce, your chances to successfully combine items.

armorSkills.name: Crag S Add
armorSkills.desc: Load Crag Shot of increasing levels in bowguns that cannot normally use it. Each level includes the shot(s) from previous levels (see the Weapons page for which weapons have what ammo by default.)

armorSkills.name: Defense
armorSkills.desc: Reduce, or increase, your total Defense.

armorSkills.name: Dragon Resistance
armorSkills.desc: Reduce, or increase, your Dragon Element Resistance.

armorSkills.name: Earplugs
armorSkills.desc: Negate the staggering effect of monster roars. Some monsters roar so loudly, only High Grade Earplugs can block them out. Diablos and Fatalis roars require High Grade Earplugs.

armorSkills.name: Eating
armorSkills.desc: Take more or less time to eat consumable items

armorSkills.name: Element Resistance
armorSkills.desc: Reduce, or increase, all of your Element Resistances.

armorSkills.name: Evasion
armorSkills.desc: Increase the amount of time that you are invulnerable during dodge moves. Normally, dodge moves have six frames of invulnerability: Evasion +1 increases this to 8 frames, +2 to 10 frames.

armorSkills.name: Expert
armorSkills.desc: Increase your weapon's affinity.

armorSkills.name: Fate
armorSkills.desc: Worsen/improve chances to receive additional items in quest rewards (see "How quest rewards work" on the Quests page.)

armorSkills.name: Fire Resistance
armorSkills.desc: Reduce, or increase, your Fire Element Resistance.

armorSkills.name: Fishing
armorSkills.desc: Increase the timing window to reel in a fish, and make the lure appear to be much bigger.

armorSkills.name: Gathering
armorSkills.desc: Worsen, or improve, your chance to gather additional items. One item is guaranteed and each successive attempt has a chance to have another item or the gathering point will be depleted. Normally this chance is 84%, and changes to the value in parentheses for the given level of this skill.

armorSkills.name: Gluttony
armorSkills.desc: Increase the amount of maximum Stamina gained when eating cooked meat by the amount in parentheses. Additionally, the Scavenging skill will occasionally increase maximum Stamina when using a recovery item. Specifically, it provides a 1/3 chance to gain 25 Maximum Stamina when using a recovery item.

armorSkills.name: Guard
armorSkills.desc: Reduce, or improve, your shield's effectiveness while blocking. You'll get knocked back farther and take more chip damage with the negative skills, less knockback and chip damage from the positive skills. This also affects the blocking animation, based on monster attack and weapon class.

armorSkills.name: Handicraft
armorSkills.desc: Reduce, or increase, the maximum sharpness of your weapon (normal and increased sharpness are included on the Weapons page per weapon.)

armorSkills.name: Health
armorSkills.desc: Reduce, or increase, your maximum Hitpoints by the given amount.

armorSkills.name: Heat Resistance
armorSkills.desc: Hasten, reduce, or totally negate the Hitpoint-depleting effects of hot zones.

armorSkills.name: High Speed Recovery
armorSkills.desc: Recover temporary damage (red bar) more slowly, or quickly, per the multipliers in parentheses.

armorSkills.name: Hunger
armorSkills.desc: Hasten, reduce, or totally negate the maximum Stamina-reducing effects of hunger.

armorSkills.name: Ice Resistance
armorSkills.desc: Reduce, or increase, your Ice Element Resistance.

armorSkills.name: Lasting Power
armorSkills.desc: Reduce or increase the duration of consumables with a time-limited effect.

armorSkills.name: Loading
armorSkills.desc: Maximizes the number of shots that can be loaded into bowguns.

armorSkills.name: Map
armorSkills.desc: Hide most of the map even with the Map supply item, or display the full locale map at all times.

armorSkills.name: Monster
armorSkills.desc: The effect of this skill is currently unknown.

armorSkills.name: Normal S Add
armorSkills.desc: Load Normal Shot of increasing levels in bowguns that cannot normally use it. Each level includes the shot(s) from previous levels (see the Weapons page for which weapons have what ammo by default.)

armorSkills.name: Normal S Up
armorSkills.desc: Deal increased 1.1x damage with Normal Shot.

armorSkills.name: Paralysis
armorSkills.desc: Suffer the effects of Paralysis for twice as long, half as long, or not at all.

armorSkills.name: Pellet S Add
armorSkills.desc: Load Pellet Shot of increasing levels in bowguns that cannot normally use it. Each level includes the shot(s) from previous levels (see the Weapons page for which weapons have what ammo by default.)

armorSkills.name: Pellet S Up
armorSkills.desc: Deal increased 1.3x damage with Pellet Shot.

armorSkills.name: Pierce S Add
armorSkills.desc: Load Pierce Shot of increasing levels in bowguns that cannot normally use it. Each level includes the shot(s) from previous levels (see the Weapons page for which weapons have what ammo by default.)

armorSkills.name: Pierce S Up
armorSkills.desc: Deal increased 1.1x damage with Pierce Shot.

armorSkills.name: Poison
armorSkills.desc: Suffer Poison for four times as long, three times, twice, half as long, or not at all.

armorSkills.name: Potential
armorSkills.desc: Affects your Attack or Defense when your health drops low enough.

armorSkills.name: Precision
armorSkills.desc: Reduce or increase precision of bowgun shots.

armorSkills.name: Protection
armorSkills.desc: Take more 1.3x damage, on occasion 25% of the time; or take less 0.7x damage, on occasion 25% of the time.

armorSkills.name: Psychic
armorSkills.desc: Detect will show a detailed monster icon on the map, as long as the monster is being tracked(if it is Paintballed or the hunter is using Psychoserum); Autotracker will additionally show monster icons on the map at all times.

armorSkills.name: Rapid Fire
armorSkills.desc: Fire bowgun shots without having to reload, except when changing ammo type. This also increases recoil (see the Recoil section under About Weapons in the Weapons page for more details.)

armorSkills.name: Recoil
armorSkills.desc: Reduce bowgun Recoil by two, or four, points. (see the Recoil section under About Weapons in the Weapons page for more details.)

armorSkills.name: Recovery Items
armorSkills.desc: Reduce, or increase, the amount of Hitpoints recovered from healing items. (This effect is not applied to other hunters when using Lifepowder or recovery items with the Wide Area skills.)

armorSkills.name: Reload Speed
armorSkills.desc: Increase, or reduce, the time it takes to reload bowgun shots (see the Reload section under About Weapons in the Weapons page for more details.)

armorSkills.name: Sense
armorSkills.desc: Draw the aggression of monsters more, or less, often than other hunters in the zone. This does not impact how a monster first detects you.

armorSkills.name: Sharpness
armorSkills.desc: Occasionally lose more, or less, sharpness when attacking with a Blademaster weapon. This also applies to sharpness lost when blocking with the Great Sword.

armorSkills.name: Silence
armorSkills.desc: Increase or reduce the duration of Silence status.

armorSkills.name: Sleep
armorSkills.desc: Sleep for twice as long, half as long, or not at all when inflicted by Sleep from a monster.

armorSkills.name: Snow Resistance
armorSkills.desc: Increase the duration, reduce the duration, or totally negate the effects of Snowman status.

armorSkills.name: Speed Gathering
armorSkills.desc: Gather items in the field and carve monsters 1.3 times more quickly.

armorSkills.name: Speed Sharpening
armorSkills.desc: Take twice, or half, as long to sharpen your weapon.

armorSkills.name: Stamina
armorSkills.desc: Increase or reduce the amount of stamina used while sprinting. The normal amount of stamina consumption for sprinting is 15 units.

armorSkills.name: Status
armorSkills.desc: Apply more 1.125x status with every hit. This applies to all Blademaster weapons that have status, Poison S, Stun S, Sleep S, Poison Coating, Para Coating, and Sleep Coating.

armorSkills.name: Stun
armorSkills.desc: Suffer the effects of being Stunned by a monster for twice as long, half as long, or not at all.

armorSkills.name: Terrain
armorSkills.desc: Increase or reduce the effects of Terrain damage.

armorSkills.name: Throw
armorSkills.desc: Throw items such as Paintballs and Throwing Knives farther.

armorSkills.name: Thunder Resistance
armorSkills.desc: Reduce, or increase, your Thunder Element Resistance.

armorSkills.name: Tremor Resistance
armorSkills.desc: Eliminate the effects of monster-induced Tremors.

armorSkills.name: Water Resistance
armorSkills.desc: Reduce, or increase, your Water Element Resistance.

armorSkills.name: Whim
armorSkills.desc: Increase, or reduce, the chance that a tool will break when used. The chance the tool will break is in parentheses.

armorSkills.name: Wide Area
armorSkills.desc: Share the effects of certain consumables with all hunters in the zone.

armorSkills.name: Wind Pressure
armorSkills.desc: Resist the effects of wind created by monsters beating their wings, kicking up dust, etc. Some monsters apply stronger Wind Pressure than others, and can only be resisted by the High Wind Pressure skill.
